com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body
Class ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation

java.lang.Object
  com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyUtility
      com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBody
          com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation

public class ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation
extends ID3v23FrameBody

An linked information frame body is associated with an ID3v2.3 LINK frame which is used to link information from another ID3v2 tag that might reside in another audio file or alone in a binary file. This allows you to include album covers, band pictures, band logos, etc. right in the .mp3 file. The attached picture frame body contains the following fields:

Attached Picture Frame Body Fields
 FieldDescription
1. frameTypetype of ID3v2.3 frame being linked.
2. url reference to the file where the frame is given.
3. additionalIdData this optional field is used to help locate a specific frame in another file when the frame type alone is not sufficient to uniquely identify it. For example, an ID3v2.3 tag may contain several images, such as the CD front cover, CD back cover, image of a live performance, etc. Thus, the attached picture frame type alone is not enough to uniquely identify a single, specific frame.

The frames IPLS, MCDI, ETCO, MLLT, SYTC, RVAD, EQUA, RVRB, RBUF, the text information frames (TALB, TBPM, TCOM, TCON, TCOP, TDAT, TDLY, TENC, TEXT, TFLT, TIME, TIT1, TIT2, TIT3, TKEY, TLAN, TLEN, TMED, TOAL, TOFN, TOLY, TOPE, TORY, TOWN, TPE1, TPE2, TPE3, TPE4, TPOS, TPUB, TRCK, TRDA, TRSN, TRSO, TSIZ, TSRC, TSSE, TYER), and the URL link frames (WCOM, WCOP, WOAF, WOAR, WOAS, WORS, WPAY, WPUB) may be linked without any additional ID data.

The AENC, APIC, GEOB and TXXX frames may be linked with the content descriptor as additional ID data.

The COMM, SYLT and USLT frames may be linked with the three character ISO-639-2 language code followed by a description as additional ID data.

There may be more than one linked information frame, but only one with the same contents.

See Also:
ID3v23Frame, ID3 tag version 2.3.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

Constructor Detail

ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation

public ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation()
The default constructor is called when creating a new frame. The default values used are:
  • attached picture frame type
  • empty URL
  • no additional id data

ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation

public ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation(FrameType frameType,
                                        java.lang.String url,
                                        byte[] additionalIdData)
This constructor is called when creating a new frame.

Parameters:
frameType - the type of ID3v2.3 linked frame.
url - the url which holds a reference to the file which contains the linked frame.
additionalIdData - the extra data which together with the frame type uniquely identifies a single frame in another file.

ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation

public ID3v23FrameBodyLinkedInformation(java.io.FileInputStream file,
                                        int frameBodySize)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
This constructor is called when reading in an existing frame from an .mp3 file. This is then followed by a call to the parse() method.

Parameters:
file - input stream pointing to a attached picture frame body in the .mp3 file.
frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the frame body.

setBuffer

public void setBuffer()
If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.

Overrides:
setBuffer in class ID3v23FrameBody

Returns:
a string representation of the frame body.
